titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Waltraude Woods, Senior Architect/Planner, Yale University, Records
Woods (Waltraude), Senior Architect/Planner, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:37

did.unittitle: Waltraude Woods, senior architect/planner, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of studies, reports, surveys, charts, and other materials documenting the activities and projects of Waltraude (Val) Woods as senior architect/planner, Office of Facilities, Yale University.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 46-A (YRG 46-A), Records and materials broadly documenting Yale buildings, facilities, and grounds.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the Office of Facilities, 2004.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Waltraude Woods, Senior Architect/Planner, Yale University, Records (RU 964). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged in eight series. I. Planning Process, 1953-2004. II. Planning Studies, 1930-2002. III. Planning Projects - Residential, 1990-2001. IV. Arts Area Planning Study, 1951-2000. V. Old Campus, 1994-1996. VI. Framework for Campus Planning Study, 1975-1998. VII. Planning Projects, circa 1968-2001. VIII. Planning Data, 1933-2001 and subsequent accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: When work begins there is usually an area planning study which involves compilation of research material and subsequent investigation, culminating in reports. This is followed by the facility construction projects related to the initial study. These involve a completion of such documents as reference material, project scope description, project authorizations, consultant selection, meeting notes, memoranda, reports, sketches, plans, specification, and estimates.

did.unittitle: Arts Area Planning Study - Arts Area, Phase II Comprehensive Programming and Planning Study (ARTS)
Yale University Art Gallery Programming - Yale University Art Gallery/Street Hall Comprehensive Renovation Study (YUAG)
Linsly Chittenden Hall/Old Campus - Non-Residential (LC/OC) Project
Assignment Plans, Capital Projects, Space Inventory System (ASSIGN PLANS, CAP PROJECTS, SIS)
Records of the University Planning Dept. as maintained by Val Woods
